plugins.name: Pix2Text ‚Äî Extract editable text from images
plugins.description:
Pix2Text lets you upload or drag an image into Figma and instantly extract the text it contains ‚Äî turning it into a fully editable text layer.


ü™Ñ How to use


1. Drag and drop or upload a JPG or PNG image

2. Select the language of the text in the image

3. Click "Extract text"

4. That‚Äôs it! The text will appear as an editable layer in Figma ‚ú®


üöÄ Features


- Extract text from JPG or PNG images

- Language selector: English, Espa√±ol, Deutsch, Portugu√™s

- One-click extraction

- Fully local and private (no internet required)

- No registration or login needed

- Powered by Tesseract.js


üîê Privacy


All processing is done locally in your browser.

Your image never leaves your computer.

plugins.name: Numeric Tokens Generator
plugins.description:
Transform your design workflow with a comprehensive design system generator that creates and manages typography, spacing, border radius, and shadow systems - all powered by Figma variables.


Key Features:

üìù Complete Typography System

  1. Generate responsive typography scales with Material Design or Apple HIG guidelines
  2. Smart font pairing validation for optimal readability
  3. Automatic variable creation for font sizes and line heights
  4. Support for custom type scales and base sizes
  5. Responsive typography with desktop, tablet, and mobile variants (Pro)


‚ÜîÔ∏è Spacing System

  1. Create consistent spacing scales based on 4px or 8px grids
  2. Generate spacing variables for margins, padding, and layout
  3. Customizable number of spacing increments
  4. Visual preview of spacing values


‚ö™ Border Radius System

  1. Build systematic border radius scales
  2. Customizable base radius and increments
  3. Visual preview of radius values
  4. Perfect for maintaining consistent component shapes


üé≠ Shadow System

  1. Create elevation-based shadow systems
  2. Customizable shadow properties (color, blur, spread)
  3. Visual angle control for consistent light sources
  4. Perfect for depth and hierarchy


üì§ Export Options

  1. Web: CSS, SCSS, JSON
  2. Mobile: React Native, Flutter, Android XML, Swift
  3. Variables-first approach for easy updates
  4. Cross-platform consistency


üìö Auto-Documentation

  1. Generate visual documentation for your design system
  2. Automatic style guides with examples
  3. Clear naming conventions
  4. Easy team handoff


üîÑ Smart Updates

  1. Detect existing settings
  2. Update system-wide changes through variables
  3. Maintain consistency across your design files


Perfect for design system creators, UI designers, and teams looking to maintain consistent, scalable design systems across web and mobile platforms.

accepted.name: Maher Fayad
accepted.description: Senior UX Designer | Transforming Products. Empowering Leaders. 40+ Success Stories. Let's Innovate Together.

plugins.name: Select Matching Layers
plugins.description:
Manually selecting identical layers in Figma is tedious and time-consuming. Watch a quick demo:

https://youtu.be/9fcnqkKZTyI


"Select Matching Layers" automates this process, allowing you to:

  1. Seamlessly select all layers matching your selection.
  2. Edit groups of layers simultaneously.
  3. Save time and focus on creating amazing designs.


This plugin is perfect for designers managing complex artboards or repetitive tasks. Boost your workflow and make Figma even more efficient!

accepted.name: Nishant Panchal
accepted.description: The AI Designer | Ex-Brex, Salesforce, BrowserStack

plugins.name: Infa
plugins.description:
What is Infa

Manage your design system inventory directly within your product's webpage. Learn more at https://infa.ai/


What does the Figma Plugin for Figma unlock?

Pull all the screenshots and code snippets for your component views from Infa into FigJam. This enhances your design system review sessions by enabling visual and code comparisons of components. Navigate back to the component in your real product through our Chrome extension, ensuring that your design critiques are grounded in actual product usage.


How to Get Started:

  1. Install the Chrome Extension: Create components and select them within the Chrome Extension:https://infa.ai/chrome-extension
  2. Upgrade to Pro: Upgrade your account to Pro and upload your board to the cloud to connect your Figma plugin.
  3. Take Screenshots and Capture Code: Open component views in the Chrome Extension and click on "Take Screenshot" or "Capture Code" to make them available in your plugin.
  4. Authenticate: Open the Figma plugin and enter your API key from your Info account to authenticate. https://infa.ai/profile#api
  5. Import Components: Select the components to import screenshots and code into FigJam.


Contact Us:

For any questions or recommendations, please reach out to us at contact@infa.ai
plugins.tagline: New way of Conducting Design System Inventory and Visualizing Design System in use with Infa

plugins.name: Figsu
plugins.description: Figsu is a plugin specifically designed to assist designers in quantifying the environmental impact of their webpage designs. This tool calculates the digital 'weight' of your webpage design, as well as the carbon emissions produced. As such, Figsu empowers designers to create webpages that are not only aesthetically appealing and user-friendly, but also environmentally sustainable.

plugins.name: AppStore Screenshot Icon Hunter
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin for automatically retrieving and laying out App Store app screenshots.


Key Features

‚Ä¢Support searching for apps by name or App ID

‚Ä¢Automatically fetch high-resolution app screenshots

‚Ä¢Support multiple data sources (App Store API, iTunes Search API)

‚Ä¢Automatically create beautiful layouts

‚Ä¢Display download progress in real time

‚Ä¢Support customizing icon sizes and spacing


Usage

1.Install the plugin in Figma

2.Search for the app by name or App ID

3.Select the target app

4.Configure layout parameters (optional)

5.Click the ‚ÄúCollect & Package‚Äù button

6.Wait for screenshot download and layout completion

plugins.name: Pinwheel Plugin
plugins.description:
Import Design Tokens JSON to Figma variables and Figma styles. Export Figma variables and styles to Design Tokens JSON. Use mode names to create groups for light mode, dark mode, and high contrast variants. Full support for importing and exporting sRGB and Display P3, allowing colors to maintain correct appearance when being moved from Figma to Pinwheel.


It‚Äôs a great way to transfer colors, numbers, strings, shadows, and booleans to and from Figma to Pinwheel, or anywhere that can import Design Tokens Community Group formatted JSON.


What's Pinwheel? We‚Äôre glad you asked. It‚Äôs an amazing app for managing your design system, converting between color formats and color spaces, and automating color contrast testing. If you work with design systems, Pinwheel is for you.

plugins.name: Ecco Icon
plugins.description:
What is Ecco Icon?

Ecco Icon is a free, ever-expanding icon pack featuring both static and animated icons. This plugin allows designers to seamlessly add static versions of the icons to their Figma designs. When it‚Äôs time for development, animated Lottie versions can be downloaded from Ecco Icon website to bring projects to life.

For more customization, designers can also download the After Effects (.aep) files from Ecco Icon website to tweak colors or use them in mockups.


Is it really free?

Yes, it is! No paywalls or registration required. All icons, including animated versions, are free to use under the Creative Commons BY 4.0 license.

Thanks to your generous donations, the project continues to grow with even more icons and features!


This icon pack is created and maintained with love by Sajjad Dashti‚Äîgraphic designer, product designer, and motion designer. For any inquiries, feel free to contact me at hi@sajjaddashti.ir.
plugins.tagline: Ecco Icon is a free pack with static and animated icons. Use this plugin to add them to your design.

plugins.name: Navigator
plugins.description:
Navigator is your personal navigation assistant in Figma. It allows you to bookmark up to 4 frames across your project for instant access. It supports across page access as well.


Navigator is perfect for designers working on large projects, enabling efficient navigation and improved productivity. Leap through your designs with ease and speed up your workflow today!




HOW TO:

Select a frame and click "Add Link" to bookmark it

Use the saved links to instantly navigate to your bookmarked frames

Clear individual links or all links as needed

Toggle the UI to keep your workspace clean
plugins.tagline: Jump between key designs quickly, streamlining workflow in large projects. Save time, stay focused!

plugins.name: Figmattack
plugins.description:
Figmattack: Your Ultimate Figma Learning Adventure Starts Here! üöÄ


Welcome to the OPEN BETA of Figmattack, the first-ever Figma LMS plugin designed specifically for designers of all levels. Whether you're just starting out or you're a seasoned pro, Figmattack offers an exciting and interactive way to sharpen your skills, take on new challenges, and grow as a designer‚Äîall within Figma!


Why Try Figmattack?


1. Gamified Learning Stages üéÆ

Explore dungeons with progressively challenging stages‚ÄîEasy, Medium, and Hard. Each dungeon tests your design skills with hands-on Exercise Stages, engaging Quizzes, and fast-paced Timebox Stages. It‚Äôs not just learning, it‚Äôs an adventure!


2. Personalized Onboarding

When you start, Figmattack adapts to your current level‚Äîbeginner, intermediate, or expert. You‚Äôll get personalized challenges that help you improve exactly where you need it most.


3. Curated Knowledge Base üìö

Access a handpicked selection of design resources and insights to support your learning journey. Whether you‚Äôre tackling a new concept or refreshing your knowledge, our knowledge base is there to guide you.


Coming Soon to Figmattack!


We‚Äôre in OPEN BETA, and that means new features are on the horizon:


  1. Leaderboard: Compete with other designers, track your progress, and rise to the top.
  2. Learning Paths: Follow structured paths that guide you from beginner to expert.
  3. Community Features: Join challenges, share tips, and collaborate with other designers within Figmattack.


Join the Figmattack Community on Discord!


We're constantly improving, and we want you to help shape Figmattack. If you encounter any bugs, have ideas for improvements, or just want to connect with other designers on the same journey, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!


Join Our Discord and be part of the growing Figmattack community! Share your experience, give feedback, and help us build the future of design learning together.


Get Started with Figmattack Today!

plugins.name: marketgoo copies
plugins.description:
Plugin to sync copies from Google Spreadsheet to Figma.


How it works?

  1. Create a Google SpreadSheet with two columns. The first column is the copy id, the second column the copy value.
  2. Publish the document to the web (File > Publish to the web) and copy the public URL.
  3. In your Figma document, create text layers using the ids in the Google SpreadSheet as names.
  4. Run marketgoo copies plugin and paste the public URL of your Google SpreadSheet document.
  5. All content of the text layers with the same name as the ids in the Google SpreadSheet will be updated with the final copies.
  6. After editing any copy in the Google Spreadsheet document, just run the plugin again to update the copies in Figma.
  7. Running the plugin after selecting any layer, will update only the selected text layers (instead of the whole document).


Features

  • You can use dynamic variables with the notation {{ varname }} in your copies. The plugin will ask you for the final value.
  • You can use the HTML tag <br> to force a line break.
  • Any other HTML tag will be removed in Figma, but used to detect the ranges of all styles in the a text layer. For example: Hello <strong>world</strong>.
  • The "Reset layer names" command is useful to un-sync copies to the spreadsheet document.
  • The "Get missing copies" command list all text layers whose names do not appear in the spreadsheet. Useful to discover and sync new copies.

plugins.name: [NEW] Gleef - Translate and localize with AI
plugins.description:
Designed for teams to automate translation and streamline localization tasks directly in Figma.


Key Features

  1. Time-saving AI generation: Automate translation, key naming and searching, eliminating manual tasks and reduce the time spent on localization management.
  2. Workflow optimization: Maintain clarity and consistency by adhering to your project's naming conventions while preventing duplicate keys.
  3. Project organization: Easily track translated and pending keys to keep your localization projects on schedule.
  4. Code quality: Ensure formatting consistency across your localization files for polished and professional results.


How Gleef works

  1. Import your localization files: Quickly upload your existing localization files to get started.
  2. Select source language: Choose the source language for translations, typically the language used in your Figma designs.
  3. Choose screens / frames: Select one or multiple screens you're localizing within your Figma project.
  4. Adjust translations and keys: Maintain full control, adjust translations before exporting, allowing for fine-tuning of re-used and generated keys.
  5. Export ready files: Import the new keys into your preferred localization tool or copy-paste the updated locale file directly into your IDE.


Integrate Gleef into your Figma workflow, to significantly improve your localization process, save time and ensure consistency across your global product designs.

plugins.name: popcons
plugins.description:
Popcons is a powerful Figma plugin that takes icon customization to the next level.

Unlike conventional icon libraries, Popcons allows you to instantly modify and compare different styles, just like fonts.


Once an icon is imported, you can edit, modify, and adjust it with a single button, eliminating the need for manual replacements.

With support for 6 thickness levels, 4 styles (Line, Solid, Line Color, Full Color), and 3 roundness options, Popcons provides unparalleled flexibility. Additionally, icons can be further enhanced with decorative elements to suit your design needs.


Now, icons can seamlessly adapt to your brand identity and design language.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Key Features of Popcons


‚úî One-Click Editing ‚Äì Instantly modify icons and compare different styles, just like fonts

‚úî 6 Thickness Levels ‚Äì Easily adjust the weight to fit your design

‚úî 4 Styles ‚Äì

* Line ‚Äì Clean and minimal outline style

* Solid ‚Äì Bold and filled for strong emphasis

* Line Color ‚Äì Customizable stroke color for additional versatility

* Full Color ‚Äì Vibrant and expressive icon style

‚úî 3 Roundness Options ‚Äì Adjust corner roundness to match your aesthetic

‚úî Decorative Additions ‚Äì Enhance icons with additional design elements

‚úî Seamless Figma Integration ‚Äì A smooth, intuitive workflow for designers



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


How Can You Use Popcons?


* UI/UX Design ‚Äì Maintain a consistent icon style across web and mobile apps

* Brand Identity ‚Äì Adjust icons to align with your brand‚Äôs design system

* Presentations & Infographics ‚Äì Visually compelling icons for effective communication

* Developer Collaboration ‚Äì Keep icons flexible and adaptable within a design system

* Quick Style Testing & Comparison ‚Äì Instantly switch between styles and compare different options



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Why Choose Popcons?


* Font-Like Customization ‚Äì Modify icons dynamically without replacing them

* Time-Saving Workflow ‚Äì Instantly compare and apply different styles with a single click

* Design Consistency ‚Äì Ensure uniformity across your project with structured customization

* Highly Flexible ‚Äì Adapt icons to fit various use cases effortlessly



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Popcons ‚Äì Make Your Icons Pop, Instantly.

plugins.name: Syncfusion¬Æ Design Tokens
plugins.description:
Syncfusion¬Æ Design Tokens: The Premier Figma Plugin for Seamless Theme Generation

The Syncfusion¬Æ Design Tokens plugin offers a professional and efficient solution for translating style changes made in Figma into custom Syncfusion¬Æ themes, ready to be applied in your applications. This tool eliminates the need for manual style transfers, streamlining the design-to-development workflow.


Key Features:

  1. Custom Theme Creation: Tailor Syncfusion¬Æ component styles in Figma to align with your unique brand identity.
  2. Effortless Token Export: Export design tokens directly from Figma with ease.
  3. Seamless Integration: Utilize the exported tokens to create custom themes in Theme Studio and implement them in your applications.


How It Works:

This streamlined process involves three simple steps:

1.Customize Your Theme

Modify the styles of Syncfusion¬Æ components within Figma to reflect your brand‚Äôs identity and design requirements.

2.Export Design Tokens

Leverage the Syncfusion¬Æ Design Tokens plugin to export your custom design tokens. The plugin generates two essential files:

  1. css-variables.css: This file contains CSS variables for both light and dark themes, derived directly from your Figma designs. Import it into your application alongside the component styles to implement your custom designs. For detailed usage, refer to the CSS Variables Documentation.
  2. -tokens.json: This JSON file (e.g., material3-tokens.json) includes style variables and values compatible with Theme Studio for further customization.

3. Tokens to Theme Files

This <theme-name>-tokens.json file, prefixed with the corresponding theme name, can be imported into Theme Studio for further customization. After processing in Theme Studio, you can download the updated styles file and integrate it into your application, bringing your custom themes to life.


Benefits:

  1. Efficiency: Minimize manual tasks and reduce errors by automating the design-to-development process.
  2. Consistency: Ensure a uniform appearance across your applications by aligning design and development seamlessly.
  3. Scalability: Easily adapt and reuse custom themes across multiple projects.


With the Syncfusion¬Æ Design Tokens plugin, you can bridge the gap between design and development, creating cohesive and visually stunning user experiences with ease.

plugins.name: Flow Text Into Components
plugins.description:
‚ÄúFlow Text Into Components‚Äù is a convenient Figma plugin designed to help you easily update text across multiple components in your design projects. This plugin simplifies the process of populating text into components, allowing you to save time and maintain consistency in your designs.


How to Use:


1.Set the text layer names in the master component and ensure the layer names in the instances match.


2.Prepare the text you want to flow into the components, separated by line breaks.


3.Open the plugin and select the group of components where you want to flow the text.


4.Enter the text you want to flow into the plugin.


5.Press the Update button.


If the plugin does not function as expected, check that the layer names in the master component and the instances are aligned. The plugin will not work if the layer names in the instances are inconsistent.
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill components with the right text

102232.name: Flow Text Into Components
102232.description:
‚ÄúFlow Text Into Components‚Äù is a convenient Figma plugin designed to help you easily update text across multiple components in your design projects. This plugin simplifies the process of populating text into components, allowing you to save time and maintain consistency in your designs.


How to Use:


1.Set the text layer names in the master component and ensure the layer names in the instances match.


2.Prepare the text you want to flow into the components, separated by line breaks.


3.Open the plugin and select the group of components where you want to flow the text.


4.Enter the text you want to flow into the plugin.


5.Press the Update button.


If the plugin does not function as expected, check that the layer names in the master component and the instances are aligned. The plugin will not work if the layer names in the instances are inconsistent.

plugins.name: Section Marker
plugins.description:
Section Marker streamlines your design process by allowing you to instantly insert labeled frames onto your canvas. With a simple UI, you can select predefined frame sizes and headings to create clear sections within your projects. Ideal for organizing content, marking boundaries, or drafting layouts, Section Marker adds a descriptive heading to each frame for easy navigation and reference. Use Section Marker to keep your design process organized and efficient.


Features:

  • Insert labeled frames with a single click.
  • Customize frame sizes to fit your design needs.
  • Enjoy a minimal and intuitive user interface.
  • Save time with quick-access options for common frame types.


How to Use:

  • Select the type of frame from the plugin UI.
  • Click 'Create' to add the frame to your canvas.
  • Drag the frame to your desired location or let it auto-position at your viewport's center.

plugins.name: Paster
plugins.description:
Access advanced pasting functionality with the ability to paste multiple layers simultaneously.


Features

  1. Paste or move layers inside a different frame, maintaining their original positions.
  2. Swap selection with copy, preserving the selection properties.
  3. Replace selection with copy, inheriting the copy properties.
  4. Paste only the properties that matter.


Available properties

  1. Absolute position: supports pasting only x or y.
  2. Auto layout
  3. Corner radius
  4. Effects
  5. Fills
  6. Interactions
  7. Name
  8. Opacity
  9. Rotation
  10. Position (relative): supports pasting only x or y.
  11. Size: supports pasting only width or height
  12. Strokes
  13. Text characters


Soon

  1. Layout grids
  2. Resizing options, like Hug and Fill.
  3. Constraints
  4. Font properties: #TBD
  5. Blend modes
  6. Export settings


Shortcuts

You have to assign them, and it works only on macOS.

  1. Control‚ÄìCommand-C: Copy selection
  2. Control‚ÄìCommand-V: Paste in place
  3. Shift-Control‚ÄìCommand-V: Move in place
  4. Control‚ÄìCommand-S: Swap with copy
  5. Control‚ÄìCommand-R: Replace with copy


Notes

  1. Paste strokes will ignore mixed stroke caps (e.g. rounded + arrow)
  2. Triggering undo after using 'Replace with copy', will prevent the plugin from closing. Reported to Figma - waiting for a solution.
  3. "View logs" is an experimental features available only to "Replace with copy".
plugins.tagline: Choose the properties you want to paste

plugins.name: Masonry tidy up
plugins.description:
A simple plugin to help get the brain waves flowing as you synthesise sticky notes from workshops or brainstorming sessions.


Key features:

  • Scale sticky notes to all be the same width and the text size will scale too, no more randomly large or small sticky notes causing havoc when trying to align things nicely ‚ú®
  • Control how many sticky notes wide you want your tidied bundle to be
  • Set the spacing between sticky notes when they're tidied, and manually adjust this using the built in pink-line spacing tools native to FigJam
  • See the width of your selection so that you can control how the notes will tidy
  • Keep things fresh and explore different perspectives - the order of the notes will randomly change each time, so you're not stuck reading the same top notes from the same person each time you go to synthesise a new group of notes


~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

‚òïÔ∏è If you love this plugin and would like to support me, you can buy me a coffee at: https://buymeacoffee.com/figmargaux

plugins.name: TagIt: Tags Manager
plugins.description:
TagIt is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of organizing and managing tags for design elements within Figma documents.


Buy me coffee


  • Assign Tags: Easily assign tags to any node in the document, including frames, groups, or individual elements.
  • One-Click Selection: Quickly select all nodes associated with a specific tag with just one click, facilitating easy editing and synchronization.
  • Create and Edit Tags: Create new tags on the fly or modify existing ones to tailor the tagging system to your workflow.
  • Color Customization: Assign colors to tags for visual differentiation and organization.
  • Reorder Tags: Arrange tags in the desired order to maintain organization and hierarchy.
  • CSV Import and Export: Seamlessly import and export tags via CSV files for efficient bulk management.


Example Usage:

  • Tag multiple instances of a design element, such as "Primary Button" across different frames or groups.
  • Use TagIt to quickly select all "primary buttons" with a single click, facilitating swift editing and customization.

accepted.description: Solving some of the use cases my team encounters when working in Figma.

plugins.name: Aspector - Image Aspect Ratio Resizer
plugins.description:
Aspector helps designers quickly resize selected elements to common or custom aspect ratios. The plugin shows the current ratio of selected elements and allows choosing from presets like 16:9, 4:3, 1:1, and more. You can also enter custom ratios and choose how dimensions are maintained (width, height, larger dimension, or smaller dimension). Perfect for preparing assets for different platforms or ensuring design consistency.


Instructions:

  1. Run the Aspector plugin
  2. Select an image, frame, or other element in Figma
  3. Choose a preset aspect ratio or enter a custom one
  4. Select how you want to maintain dimensions
  5. Click "Resize" to apply changes


What problem does this plugin solve?

Manually calculating and adjusting dimensions to achieve specific aspect ratios is time-consuming and error-prone. Aspector automates this process, saving designers time and ensuring precise results.
plugins.tagline: Quickly resize images and frames to specific aspect ratios while maintaining dimensions.

plugins.name: Generators & Sync Styles
plugins.description:
Create and Synchronize Local Color and Text Styles


Effortlessly create local color styles from selected frames and rectangles, while also generating global text styles from selected text layers. This plugin streamlines your design process by ensuring consistency across your project.


How it Works:


Selection: Simply select any frames, rectangles, or text layers within your Figma document.

Style Generation: Run the plugin to automatically generate local color styles based on the fill colors of the selected objects. For text layers, global text styles will be created based on the selected text properties.


Synchronization: The plugin intelligently synchronizes identical elements by matching both colors and text styles. Any duplicate styles will be updated accordingly, maintaining a cohesive look throughout your design.


With a clean interface and efficient workflow, this plugin enhances your design efficiency and style management.


Important!

The name of each color style will match the corresponding layer name, while the name of each text style will correspond to the selected text layer name. You can use a "/" in either layer name to organize your styles into groups. All styles will be arranged from largest to smallest based on their size.
plugins.tagline: Effortless style creation and synchronization for your designs!

plugins.name: How You Use Color
plugins.description:
How you actually use color?


Usage:

  1. Select one component and click GENERATE, and pixels will be reorganized as bar.
  2. Hover on each block to see percentage of area each color occupied in that component.


Note:

  • Only one random component will be pick if multiple are selected.
  • There is a color are picked with some hardcoded tolerance at this moment, so might not be one hundred percent accurate. And we are considering to expose tolerance as input in future update.
plugins.tagline: Check your color usage in percentage!

plugins.name: Quick Prototype
plugins.description:
Perfect for designers who want to quickly create interactive prototypes without the tedious task of manually connecting each frame. Boost your productivity and focus more on design iterations rather than prototype setup.


Key features


  1. Instantly connect multiple frames in sequence
  2. Intelligently sorts frames based on position
  3. Creates smooth smart animate transitions
  4. Works with frames and instances
  5. Works with both top-level frames and nested frames (frames inside other frames).
plugins.tagline: Essential keyboard shortcut to add interactions in series
